text: We will hear arguments next in No. 80-1431.

Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court, the question in this case is whether a state may adopt rules relating to legal advertising when the necessary effect is to inhibit advertising which is truthful, effectual, not misleading, and beneficial to the public.

Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court, the discussion that has been going on most recently in this presentation by Mr. Blackmar I think really gets at the heart of the issue, which I believe the Court was trying to cover in the Bates case.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court, certainly this rule does not comply with the Central Hudson test, because it does prevent the dissemination of valuable information to the public.
